message.content:
We have to “build‐up” the non‑current assets balance (the “property, plants and equipment” item) as follows:

• On December 31, 2023 the “opening” (initial) fixed‑assets balance is given by the “Initial” transaction with type “Fixed Assets” – its amount is 8,000,000.00. (This is our “initial non‑current assets” value.)

During the same day (2023‑12‑31) several fixed‑asset acquisitions occur. (They are “Purchase” or “Fixed Assets Purchase” lines whose products are “Heavy Equipment …”, “Production Line Equipment …”, “Industrial Facilities …”, etc – that is, they add to property, plant and equipment.) In our data these acquisitions are:

1. Purchase20231231001 (“Heavy Equipment C”):            +1,000,000.00  
2. FixedAsset20231231001 (“Production Line Equipment4”):     +758,493.61  
3. Purchase20231231002 (“Heavy Equipment C”):         +1,000,000.00  
4. Purchase20231231003 (“Heavy Equipment C”):         +1,000,000.00  
5. Purchase20231231004 (“Heavy Equipment D”):         +1,500,000.00  
6. Purchase20231231005 (“Heavy Equipment D”):         +3,000,000.00  
7. Purchase20231231006 (“Heavy Equipment B”):         +1,600,000.00  
8. Purchase20231231007 (“Heavy Equipment B”):         +800,000.00  
9. Purchase20231231008 (“Heavy Equipment A”):         +1,000,000.00  
10. Purchase20231231009 (“Heavy Equipment C”):        +1,600,000.00  
11. Purchase20231231010 (“Heavy Equipment D”):        +1,500,000.00  
12. Purchase20231231011 (“Heavy Equipment A”):        +500,000.00  
13. Purchase20231231012 (“Heavy Equipment B”):        +1,600,000.00  
14. Purchase20231231013 (“Heavy Equipment A”):        +500,000.00  
15. Purchase20231231014 (“Heavy Equipment D”):        +1,500,000.00  
16. Purchase20231231015 (“Heavy Equipment D”):        +3,000,000.00  
17. Purchase20231231016 (“Heavy Equipment C”):        +2,000,000.00  
18. Purchase20231231017 (“Heavy Equipment D”):        +1,500,000.00  
19. Purchase20231231018 (“Heavy Equipment D”):        +3,000,000.00  

When we sum these “additions” we obtain:
  1,000,000.00  
+  758,493.61   = 1,758,493.61  
+  1,000,000.00  = 2,758,493.61  
+  1,000,000.00  = 3,758,493.61  
+  1,500,000.00  = 5,258,493.61  
+  3,000,000.00  = 8,258,493.61  
+  1,600,000.00  = 9,858,493.61  
+  800,000.00   = 10,658,493.61  
+  1,000,000.00  = 11,658,493.61  
+  1,600,000.00  = 13,258,493.61  
+  1,500,000.00  = 14,758,493.61  
+  500,000.00   = 15,258,493.61  
+  1,600,000.00  = 16,858,493.61  
+  500,000.00   = 17,358,493.61  
+  1,500,000.00  = 18,858,493.61  
+  3,000,000.00  = 21,858,493.61  
+  2,000,000.00  = 23,858,493.61  
+  1,500,000.00  = 25,358,493.61  
+  3,000,000.00  = 28,358,493.61  

Thus the acquisitions add up to 28,358,493.61.

Now before we arrive at the “end‐of‐period” (final) balance we must subtract accumulated depreciation. In our data there are two Depreciation entries:
• Depreciation20240101001:  45,749.96  
• Depreciation20240201002:  75,220.20  
Total depreciation = 45,749.96 + 75,220.20 = 120,970.16

So we have:

 • Initial non‑current assets = 8,000,000.00  
 • Acquisitions (additions) = 28,358,493.61  
 • Gross cost at end of period = 8,000,000.00 + 28,358,493.61 = 36,358,493.61  
 • After subtracting depreciation 120,970.16, we obtain  
  Final non‑current assets = 36,358,493.61 – 120,970.16 = 36,237,523.45

It is customary to present the numbers rounded to two decimal places.

Thus we report:

 Total Non-current Assets Initial Value = 8,000,000.00  
 Total Non-current Assets End Value = 36,237,523.45
